visual.description: WHO & CDC evidence-based visual guides for donning and doffing personal protective equipment (PPE)
visual.note: ⚠️ Critical: Doffing is higher risk than donning due to contamination. Must be done slowly, carefully, and with supervision in high-risk settings.

donning.title: 1. Hand hygiene
donning.note: Wash hands with soap and water for 40-60 seconds or use alcohol-based hand sanitizer for 20+ seconds.

donning.title: 2. Put on gown
donning.note: Tie securely at neck and waist. Ensure it fully covers torso from neck to knees and arms to end of wrists.

donning.title: 3. Put on mask or respirator
donning.note: Secure ties or elastic bands at back of head and neck. For N95: perform seal check by inhaling and exhaling sharply.

donning.title: 4. Put on eye protection
donning.note: Use goggles or face shield. Ensure no gaps and covers front and sides of eyes completely.

donning.title: 5. Put on gloves
donning.note: Extend gloves over the cuffs of gown. Select appropriate size for comfort and dexterity.

doffing.title: 1. Remove gloves
doffing.note: Peel off first glove from wrist, inside out. Hold removed glove in gloved hand. Slide fingers of bare hand under second glove and peel off. Discard properly.
doffing.warning: Most contaminated item - highest risk step

doffing.title: 2. Hand hygiene
doffing.note: Perform hand hygiene immediately after glove removal using ABHR or soap and water.

doffing.title: 3. Remove gown
doffing.note: Untie waist and neck ties. Peel gown away from neck and shoulders, turning inside out. Roll contaminated side inward.
doffing.warning: Avoid shaking or contact with clothing

doffing.title: 4. Hand hygiene
doffing.note: Perform hand hygiene again after gown removal before touching face or mask.

doffing.title: 5. Remove eye protection
doffing.note: Handle by earpieces or headband only. Avoid touching the front. Place in designated reprocessing or disposal container.

doffing.title: 6. Remove mask/respirator
doffing.note: Do not touch front of mask. Untie ties or remove elastic bands from ears/head. Remove OUTSIDE patient care area.
doffing.warning: Remove outside patient room - final step

doffing.title: 7. Final hand hygiene
doffing.note: Perform thorough hand hygiene after all PPE removal. Use ABHR or soap and water for complete decontamination.

items: Hand hygiene for all patient care

commonMistakes.mistake: Incorrect doffing sequence - removing mask before leaving patient area
commonMistakes.fix: WHO & CDC: Remove respirator/mask LAST, outside patient care area, after all other PPE removal.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not performing hand hygiene between PPE removal steps
commonMistakes.fix: Perform hand hygiene after glove removal and after gown removal as minimum requirement.
Use glove-to-glove, skin-to-skin technique. Avoid touching outer surfaces of removed PPE.

commonMistakes.mistake: Inadequate seal check for N95 respirators
commonMistakes.fix: Always perform positive and negative pressure seal check. Inhale sharply - mask should collapse slightly.
Follow facility guidelines for PPE reuse. Most PPE is single-use and should be discarded after patient contact.

commonMistakes.mistake: No supervision during high-risk doffing procedures
commonMistakes.fix: WHO recommends trained observer during doffing in aerosol-generating procedure settings.
